title: SB 1.18.48 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 30-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadardhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naramchaiva Narottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 48th verse of the 18th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Tiraskrita vipralabdhaha
shaptahah shivta hata api
nashetat pratikurvanti
tattbhaktah prabhavo api hi
The meaning of this verse is
The devotees of the Lord are so forbearing
that even though they are defamed, cheated, cursed, disturbed,
neglected or even
killed they are never inclined to avenge themselves this is a word spoken by
Suta Goswami glorifying a pure devotee of the Lord what is the quality of a
pure devotee they are always very very very very tolerant titikshava karunika
surdha sarva dehi naam in the another place in bhagavatam third canto Lord
Kapila describes pure devotees titikshava first come quality he says of
a pure devotees he is very very tolerant so tolerant that when they are defamed
they are cheated they are cursed they are disturbed neglected or even killed they
will never die.
never react they will never take action against those who misbehave is so
tolerant so in the purport Srila Prabhupada explains Rishi Shamika knew that the Lord
does not forgive a person who is committed an offense at the feet of a
devotee.
move it definitely.
the obviamente the Lord is not concise till we understand it is clear so
Straight Government today is to help benefit the poorasto that is already
been explained earlier therefore he begged forgiveness from the Lord on
behalf of his son.
But.
ah.
what can the Lord do.
code 3.
shelter of the devotee like it happened in the case of Durvasamuni when Durvasamuni offended
Ambarish Maharaj Ambarish Maharaj is a pure devotee so Ambarish Maharaj did not retaliate
but the supreme lord cannot tolerate his devotee being harmed by anybody else so when Durvasamuni
started to harass Ambarish Maharaj by creating one one Rakshasa to harass him harass Ambarish
Maharaj immediately Krishna sent a Sudarshan chakra to kill that Rakshasa immediately immediately
then
that Sudarshan chakra did not stop at that Sudarshan chakra started chasing Durvasamuni
himself Durvasamuni tried to escape by all his mystic power he could not escape finally
he thought of taking shelter of some powerful devatas that didn't work finally he was directed
to go to Vishnu himself who is actually the one who has released the Sudarshan chakra
so when he went to Vishnu Vishnu said I am completely under the subordination of my
pure devotees so if at all you want any relief you can get relief only if you are pardoned
by Ambarish Maharaj whom you have offended
so Durvasamuni had Canyonаровός
to come back to Ambarish Maharaj whom he had offended. So therefore Prabhupada says the
Lord can only give direction to take shelter of the devotee whom somebody has offended
to get free from the offense. Further Srila Prabhupada says he thought within himself
that is Rishi Shamika is thinking that if Maharaj Pariksit would counter curse the boy
he might be saved. The boy can be saved from any action being taken by the Lord if Pariksit
Maharaj would have taken some action against the boy. But Rishi Shamika knew also that
a pure devotee is callous about worldly advantages or reverses. He knew that Pariksit
Maharaj will never take any counter action against the boy because he is a pure devotee.
He tolerates any amount of inconvenience for the personal self a pure devotee simply tolerates.
As such the devotees are never inclined to counteract personal deformation, curses, negligence,
and aversion. As far as such things are concerned, in personal affairs the devotees do not care
for them. So this is another verse from the Bhagavatam.
Tattenu Kampaamsu Sameeksham Ano Bunjana Evatma Krta Mvipakam. Hrid-Vaagva Purubhya
Vidadhan Namaste Jivetayo Mukti Padesha Dayabhak. This is a verse spoken by Brahma. He has shown
In offering his prayers to Krishna after the Brahma Vimohana Leela
What is Brahma saying this prayer? He says my dear Lord
Those who are your pure devotees
Brahma is glorifying Krishna's pure devotees. He's telling Krishna your pure devotees
whenever they are
Facing some danger in the material world only the material world this can happen some danger
some
deformation
some
Difficulty some insult
Anything that a pure devotee faces like this
He considers that to be the mercy of the Supreme Personality of Godhead
A pure devotee does not think I am a pure devotee. I am fully dedicated and surrender to Krishna
Why does Krishna not prevent me from suffering?
So pure devotee never thinks like that a
pure devotees thinks that
Let me gladly
suffer
whatever difficulty is dangers or miseries or
Any situation in this material world let me undergo
Let me tolerate
suffer
with
tolerance
Why because the pure devotee thinks actually I deserve to suffer much much more
For my own past misdeeds
Atma Krita Vipakam
But Krishna is so kind to me
that
He is not giving me
the
punishment, which is
the
proper
Punishment which is due to my own misdeeds. I
Don't know I'm getting what I deserve
I am getting a small
token a
small token of what I deserve to get
So that is Krishna's mercy upon me. That's how the pure devotee thinks
I am getting a small token of what I deserve to get. So that is Krishna's mercy upon me. That's how the pure devotee thinks.
But in the case of
An offense committed by somebody against the Lord or Lord's other devotees
Then the pure devotee takes strong action against the offender
So the way a pure devotee deals with somebody who's committing an offense
It's the consideration is twofold
if
somebody offends
The pure devotee himself the pure devotee does not take any action against the offender
He tolerates whatever the offender might have done
But if the offender is offending the Supreme Lord or other pure devotees
Then this pure devotee will not
Tolerate will not sit quiet. He will take proper action against the offender
It was a personal affair and therefore Shamika Rishi knew that the king would not take counteraction
That
Rishi Shamika knew because he knew Pariksit Maharaj is a pure devotee
Thus there was no alternative than to place an appeal to the Lord for the immature boy
Why did the Shamika Rishi
Appeal to the Supreme Lord and not to Pariksit Maharaj
Because Pariksit Maharaj he knew will never take any counteraction will never take an offense
So don't have to go and ask him pardon is he will never take any counteraction, but what about the Lord
Lord is not going to tolerate
so therefore
Shamika Rishi had to beg forgiveness from the Lord and not from Pariksit Maharaj
So here for the Srila Prabhupada says it is not only that
The brahmanas are powerful enough to award curses of blessings upon the subordinates
the devotee of the Lord
Even though he may not be a Brahmana is more powerful than a Brahmana
So here
the
Pure devotee happens to be a Kshatriya
But generally Kshatriyas are subordinate to brahmanas
So even though Kshatriyas are definitely subordinate to brahmanas
But in the case of the Kshatriya being a pure devotee
Such a pure devotee is more powerful than the brahmana qualified brahmana

A pure devotee is the most powerful personality in the entire creation. He is more powerful than all the demigods, he is more powerful than the most pure brahmana, he is more powerful than all the jnanis, yogis, tapasvis, all kinds of people.

He is more powerful than everybody. But a powerful devotee never misuses the power for personal benefit. This is the characteristic of a pure devotee. He knows he has power. As a pure devotee he knows.
And that's how a pure devotee, because he is powerful, he can take action against offenders who are offenders against Krishna.
Or offenders against other pure devotees. That's how a pure devotee can take action. He is capable, he is powerful to take action and he does so.
What did Hanuman do? Hanuman burnt Lanka. Why? Because Ravana was blaspheming Lord Rama.
At first when Hanuman went to get the whereabouts of Sita Devi.
Hanuman was trying to see what is the strength of Ravana.
So Hanuman did something by which Hanuman was taken in front of Ravana.
So when he was taken in front of Ravana, Ravana first insulted Hanuman. Hanuman tolerated silently.
But when Ravana started insulting Rama, Hanuman became angry. And in that anger he burnt half of Lanka.
So a devotee is very very powerful pure devotee. But he will use that power only against offenders who are offenders of the Supreme Lord.
Or offenders against other pure devotees. He will never use his power to counteract offenses committed by somebody against himself.
Whatever power the devotee may have is always utilized in service towards the Lord and his devotees. Other devotees. That's all.
So I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
